Description: Body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; creamy slip on interior: towards rim, frieze of rosettes and sets of verticals, some with added red; to the centre, black band with superimposed red and white lines; part of black petal with added red; exterior reserved with two brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1072)
